MCQ: Who coined the term machine learning in 1959?
Choices: a: Donald Hebb | b: Walter Pitts | c: Arthur Samuel | d: Warren McCulloch

MCQ: What was the name of the experimental 'learning machine' developed by Raytheon Company in the early 1960s?
Choices: a: Cyberdyne | b: Cybertron | c: Cybernet | d: Cyberbrain

MCQ: Who provided a widely quoted definition of the algorithms studied in the machine learning field?
Choices: a: Tom M. Mitchell | b: Donald Hebb | c: Alan Turing | d: Arthur Samuel

MCQ: What is one of the objectives of modern-day machine learning?
Choices: a: To cook food | b: To classify data based on developed models | c: To build cars | d: To fly airplanes

MCQ: What is the purpose of a machine learning algorithm for stock trading?
Choices: a: To predict the weather | b: To inform the trader of future potential predictions | c: To write novels | d: To perform surgery
